previouslyApplied.legend: Have you or anyone currently living at your address applied for an integration loan before?

someoneElse.label: Another person living at my address

partner.legend: Do you have a partner with you in the UK?

joint.legend: Are you applying for a loan together with your partner?

niNumber.label: National Insurance number
niNumber.hint: For example, ‘QQ 12 34 56 C’. You can find this on the back of your biometric residence permit (BRP).

hasOtherNames.legend: Have you been known by any other names?

homeOfficeReference.label: Home Office reference number
homeOfficeReference.hint: For example, ‘A1234567’ or ‘VPR1234’. You can find this on your asylum application letter from the Home Office. It’s sometimes called ‘Case ID’.

convicted.legend: Have you ever been convicted of a crime in the UK?

partnerNiNumber.label: National Insurance number
partnerNiNumber.hint: For example, ‘QQ 12 34 56 C’. You can find this on the back of your partner’s biometric residence permit (BRP).

partnerHasOtherNames.legend: Has your partner been known by any other names?

convictedJoint.legend: Have you or your partner ever been convicted of a crime in the UK?

dependents.legend: Do you have any dependants living with you?

incomeTypes.hint: Select all options that apply to you.

universal_credit.label: Universal Credit
universal_credit.hint: Enter the amount you expect to receive if you haven’t yet had a payment.

universalCreditAmount.label: Total Universal Credit amount per month

childBenefitAmount.label: Total child benefit amount per month

housingBenefitAmount.label: Total housing benefit amount per month

otherIncomeAmount.label: Total other income amount per month

combinedIncomeTypes.legend: You and your partner’s combined monthly income
combinedIncomeTypes.hint: Select all options that apply to you.

universal_credit.label: Universal Credit
universal_credit.hint: Enter the amount you expect to receive if you haven’t yet had a payment.

combinedUniversalCreditAmount.label: Total Universal Credit amount per month

combinedChildBenefitAmount.label: Total child benefit amount per month

combinedHousingBenefitAmount.label: Total housing benefit amount per month

combinedOtherIncomeAmount.label: Total other income amount per month

outgoingTypes.hint: Select all options that currently apply to you.

other.label: Other
other.hint: This includes payments for credit card debt and loans.

combinedHouseholdBillsAmount.label: Total utility bills amount per month

combinedFoodToiletriesAndCleaningSupplie.label: Total food, toiletries and cleaning supplies amount per month

combinedMobilePhoneAmount.label: Total mobile phone amount per month

combinedClothingAndFootwearAmount.label: Total clothing and footwear amount per month

combinedUniversalCreditDeductionsAmount.label: Total Universal Credit deductions per month

combinedOutgoingTypes.legend: You and your partner’s combined monthly outgoings
combinedOutgoingTypes.hint: Select all options that currently apply to you.

other.label: Other
other.hint: This includes payments for credit card debt and loans.

householdBillsAmount.label: Total utility bills amount per month

foodToiletriesAndCleaningSuppliesAmount.label: Total food, toiletries and cleaning supplies amount per month

mobilePhoneAmount.label: Total mobile phone amount per month

clothingAndFootwearAmount.label: Total clothing and footwear amount per month

universalCreditDeductionsAmount.label: Total Universal Credit deductions per month

combinedSavings.legend: Do you or your partner have any savings?

amount.label: Loan amount
amount.hint: You can apply for a minimum of £100 and a maximum of £500.

jointAmount.label: Loan amount
jointAmount.hint: You can apply for a minimum of £100 and a maximum of £780.

purposeTypes.legend: What will you use the loan for?
purposeTypes.hint: Select all options that apply to you.

housing.label: Housing
housing.hint: Deposit, rent payment or moving costs.

essential_items.label: Essential items
essential_items.hint: For example, furniture, fridge, curtains or carpets.

basic_living_costs.label: Basic living costs
basic_living_costs.hint: For example, food or household bills.

accountNumber.label: Account number
accountNumber.hint: Must be between 6 and 8 digits long

rollNumber.label: Building society or credit union number (if you have one)
rollNumber.hint: You can find this on your card, statement or passbook

contactTypes.legend: How would you like us to contact you?

phone.label: Mobile phone number
phone.hint: For international numbers include the country code

likelyToMove.legend: Are you likely to move to another address in the next 4 weeks?

hadHelp.legend: Did you get any help making this application?

no_internet.label: I don’t have access to the internet

english_not_first_language.label: English is not my first language

not_confident.label: I’m not confident to answer the questions correctly

faster.label: It was faster to complete the application

health_condition.label: I have a health condition which makes completing the form online difficult

helpContactTypes.hint: We may need to get in contact with them if we need more information. Select at least one option.

journey.header: Apply for a refugee integration loan

index.header: Apply for a refugee integration loan
index.text1: If you are a refugee or have been given humanitarian protection, you can apply for a loan to help you settle into UK society.
index.text2: To apply, you will need your:
index.text3: If you are applying together with a partner, you will also need their BRP details.
index.getHelpText1-2: can help you with your application and filling in the form.
index.getHelpText2: You can also contact the integration loan team at integrationloan@homeoffice.gov.uk

previously-applied.header: Have you or anyone currently living at your address applied for an integration loan before?

partner.header: Do you have a partner with you in the UK?
partner.intro: A partner is someone over the age of 18 who you’re married to or in a civil partnership with, or live with as if you are.

joint.header: Are you applying for a loan together with your partner?

brp.header: What are your biometric residence permit (BRP) details?
brp.intro: Enter your details as they appear on your BRP.

ni-number.header: What is your National Insurance number?

has-other-names.header: Have you been known by any other names?

home-office-reference.header: What is your Home Office reference number?

partner-brp.header: What are your partner’s biometric residence permit (BRP) details?
partner-brp.intro: Enter details as they appear on your partner’s BRP.

partner-ni-number.header: What is your partner’s National Insurance number?

partner-has-other-names.header: Has your partner been known by any other names?

convictions.header: Have you ever been convicted of a crime in the UK?
convictions.intro: Some crimes could affect your application, but we won’t use this information for anything else.

convictions-joint.header: Have you or your partner ever been convicted of a crime in the UK?
convictions-joint.intro: Some crimes could affect your application, but we won’t use this information for anything else.

dependents.header: Do you have any dependants living with you?
dependents.intro: A dependant could be a child under 18, grandchild, parent, or someone who depends on you for care.

intro.default: You can add more dependants later.

humanitarian-refugee-status-date.header: What date were you granted refugee or humanitarian protection status?

address.header: What is your address in the UK?
address.intro: If you have no fixed address, enter an address where we can contact you.

amount.header: What loan amount would you like to apply for?

combined-income.header: You and your partner’s combined monthly income

combined-outgoings.header: You and your partner’s combined monthly outgoings

combined-savings.header: Do you or your partner have any savings?

combined-amount.header: What loan amount would you like to apply for?

purpose.header: What will you use the loan for?

bank-details.header: What are your bank or building society account details?
bank-details.intro: We will send your loan to this account.

contact.header: How would you like us to contact you?

outcome.postTo: We will post your decision letter to

help.header: Did you get any help making this application?

who-helped.header: What are the details of the person who helped you?

confirm.header: Check your answers before sending your application
confirm.text1: By submitting this application, you agree that:
confirm.bullet1: the information is correct and complete as far as you know
confirm.bullet2: you will use the loan for its intended purpose
confirm.bullet3: you have read and understood the

confirmation.text1: We’ll contact you with the outcome of your application or if we need more information from you.
confirmation.text2: If you have been successful, we will send you a loan agreement by email or post. You will need to go online to accept the terms of this agreement.
confirmation.text3: If you have been unsuccessful, we will write to you explaining the reasons for this decision.

ineligible.header: You cannot apply for a loan
ineligible.text1: As you or your partner have already received an integration loan, you cannot apply again.
ineligible.text2: Your local refugee community organisation may be able to tell you what other support is available.
